main event: On 7 November 1957, in Winston-Salem, North Carolina, civilians reported a triangular shaped object of silver color, which appeared to be rotating and very bright when caught by the sun.
interesting points: The object was described as triangular shaped and silver in color, with a bright and rotating appearance when caught by the sun.
The official explanation suggested that the object could have been one of many objects arising at that time of day, indicating a partly explainable sighting.
The report mentions broken clouds and surface winds from the south at ten mph, providing additional atmospheric context for the sighting.
The report also includes details from the Aerospace Air Technical Intelligence Center and the Aircraft Control Tower at Winston Salem.
Despite the lack of a photograph, the report provides specific details such as the angle and heading of the object, as well as the duration of the sighting, adding credibility to the account.
sighted object: Triangular shaped, silver colored rotating object
